verses.roman:
grāmya-kathā nā śunibe, grāmya-vārtā nā kahibe
bhāla nā khāibe āra bhāla nā paribe

synonyms: grāmya-kathā—ordinary talks of common men; nā śunibe—never hear; grāmya-vārtā—ordinary news; nā kahibe—do not speak; bhāla—well; nā khāibe—do not eat; āra—and; bhāla—nicely; nā paribe—do not dress.
translation: "Do not talk like people in general or hear what they say. You should not eat very palatable food, nor should you dress very nicely.
